qas.question: What happened to the Curonians who lived in the area in East Prussia?
What did the Russians consider Curonians?
Where did most of the Curonians flee to in 1958?
In what year did the evacuation of East Prussia occur?
How many Curonians immigrated to West Germany in 1958?
How many Curonians had German names?
How many Curonians fled from the Red Army?
How many Curonians were left behind after many immigrated to West Germany in 1958?

context: A similar fate befell the Curonians who lived in the area around the Curonian Lagoon. While many fled from the Red Army during the evacuation of East Prussia, Curonians that remained behind were subsequently <a0_0>expelled by the Soviet Union<a0_0/>. Only <b4_0><b5_0><b6_0><b7_0>219<b7_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/><b4_0/> lived along the Curonian Spit in <b3_0>1955<b3_0/>. Many had German names such as Fritz or Hans, a cause for anti-German discrimination. The Soviet authorities considered the Curonians <a1_0>fascists<a1_0/>. Because of this discrimination, many immigrated to <a2_0>West Germany<a2_0/> in 1958, where the majority of Curonians now live.
